data.title: North West
data.meta_description: Visiting museums, art galleries and other cultural institutions, is a great way to find out more about anthropology.
data.text:
Blackburn

Blackburn Museum and Art Gallery

Museum Street, Blackburn, Lancashire BB1 7AJ

Tel: 01254667130

Admission: Free.

Collections: The collection consists of African and Oceanian ethnology, Egyptology, and local archaeology.

Website: http://blackburnmuseum.org.uk/

Liverpool

Liverpool Museum (now part of National Museums and Galleries of Liverpool)

Liverpool Museum, William Brown Street

Liverpool, Merseyside L3 8EN, England

Tel: 0151 4784597

Admission: By NMGM Eight Pass: £3 adults, £1.50 conc. 12 months' unlimited admission to all 8 NMGM venues.

Collections: The Ethnology Department holds all material from the Americas including Pre-Columbian archaeological material, Africa, the Pacific and parts of mainland and island Asia, and parts of Europe. The Antiquities Department holds material from various periods from South-East Asia and archaeological material from Europe and Asia. Other material is held in the Departments of Decorative Arts and Social and Industrial History.

Website: www.liverpoolmuseums.org.uk/

Manchester

Manchester Museum (The University of Manchester)

Oxford Road, Manchester M13 9PL

Tel: 0161 275263

Admission: Free.

Collections: Extensive archaeology collections, especially Egyptology including extensive collections of ancient Egyptian artefacts from prehistoric Egypt to the Byzantine era. There is also a worldwide collection of archery.

Website: www.museum.manchester.ac.uk/

Warrington

Warrington Museum and Art Gallery
